item.title: Health and Safety issue on 25 Remington Road N15 6SS, 30th August
item.description:
Since new buildings were built this resident has closed this pathway pedestrian pathway which is against the highway laws. Us residents want this pathway to be inspected this Side of the road is a communal area occupied by 25 Remington road n15 6ss which is planting trees bushes which is obstructing the view of the road as driver cannot see pedestrians walking towards them because of this garden. There should be no garden here according to the highway laws it is health and Saffet hazardous matter please help us

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner between Shoot-Up Hill and either Kingscroft Road or St Cuthberts Road, 30th August
item.description:
There is a dead cat and some blood on the pavement, the cat might have been moved to the edge of the pavement, and it looks like it might have been someone’s pet so they might be searching for them.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shoot Up Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheelie bins and bags of rubbish on pavement outside Kirwan Court entrance in Burnt Ash Lane, 30th August
item.description:
These bins and rubbish bags have been left outside these flats for 2 days now, the refuse collectors did not take them I presume because it’s mixed waste and not bottles which was this weeks collection. These bins and bags are constantly being left on the pavement when they should in fact be left in their bin store. When it’s windy some rubbish gets blown into the road or around the pavement causing an obstruction

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burnt Ash Lane, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle blocking access, 29th August
item.description:
A large dark vehicle has been left unattended on the pavement for several hours and remains there blocking access to the 17 properties in Coopers Mews BR3. If it remains in its current position people can neither enter or leave the mews, including the dustmen who are due tomorrow morning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coopers Mews, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
